original_definition: 'cooker' means an appliance consisting of an oven and a hob using gas or electricity;
generated_definition: 'cooker' means a device for heating food by direct heat or hot gas, used for cooking, baking, or boiling.

Article 1: 1.   This Regulation establishes eco-design requirements for the placing on the market and putting into service of domestic ovens (including when incorporated in cookers), domestic hobs and domestic electric range hoods, including when sold for non-domestic purposes.

1.   This Regulation establishes eco-design requirements for the placing on the market and putting into service of domesticovens (including when incorporated incookers), domestichobs and domestic electricrange hoods, including when sold for non-domestic purposes.
Article 2: ‘cooker’ means an appliance consisting of an oven and a hob using gas or electricity;
‘cooker’ means an appliance consisting of anovenand ahob using gas or electricity;
Article 8: Cavities of domesticovens (including when incorporated incookers) shall comply with maximum Energy Efficiency Index limits as indicated in Table 1.
Cavities of domestic ovens (including when incorporated in cookers) shall comply with maximum Energy Efficiency Index limits as indicated in Table 1.
